title: '2 reasons': Trump confirms he authorised CIA 'covert operation' in Venezuela - watch
content: US President Trump has authorized a covert CIA operation in Venezuela, citing the release of prisoners and mental patients into the US and the flow of drugs as primary reasons. He suggested the measures aim to increase pressure on Caracas, while Venezuelan President Maduro denounced the move as a CIA-orchestrated coup. Tensions escalate as US forces engage suspected drug-smuggling vessels.

title: US shutdown: Judge blocks Trump from firing federal workers; 'can't be tolerated'
content: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from firing federal workers during the ongoing government shutdown, citing a lack of proper consideration and a "human cost." The decision followed a legal challenge by labor unions arguing the layoff notices were an illegal attempt to pressure Congress.

title: IND vs AUS: Shocking! Shastri breaks silence on Rohit and Kohli’s retirement
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri believes Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have "enough cricket in them" for future ODIs, including the 2027 World Cup, but emphasizes individual hunger and fitness. He suggests players will decide their own ODI futures, similar to their Test retirements, as the BCCI dismisses speculation about the Australia series being their last.

title: Goldman Sachs to employees: Expect more rounds of job cuts, ‘it’s become clear that…’
content: Goldman Sachs is preparing for another round of job cuts before year-end, aiming to achieve further savings and leverage efficiencies from artificial intelligence. Despite this, the bank anticipates an overall increase in headcount by the end of the year. The new "OneGS 3.0" strategy emphasizes AI's role in enhancing operational efficiency across various functions.

title: IND vs AUS: 'He’s serious about 2027'- RCB teammate confirms Virat Kohli’s comeback for WC
content: Dinesh Karthik revealed that Virat Kohli is actively training for the 2027 World Cup, dedicating time to practice during his recent London break. The star batsman, who has a remarkable ODI record, is reportedly serious about his ambition to participate in the next global tournament.

title: ChatGPT to soon allow erotica: OpenAI to launch new policy; safety stressed
content: OpenAI will allow verified adult users to generate erotica content from December 2025, shifting from previous mental health-focused restrictions. This new policy, "treat adults like adults," aims to offer a more personalized experience with enhanced safety tools and robust age verification. The company emphasizes responsible content handling while protecting minors.

title: ‘As soon as I say’: Trump says Israel could return to Gaza; vows all hostages will be freed
content: US President Donald Trump declared that Israeli forces could re-enter Gaza on his command if Hamas violates the ceasefire. He stated that Israel would swiftly address Hamas's non-compliance with hostage releases. Trump emphasized Hamas must disarm, warning of forceful action if they refuse, while also mentioning international backing for his peace plan.

title: TCS layoffs: HR chief clarifies; ‘We are not chasing a target’
content: Tata Consultancy Services HR head Sudeep Kunnumal addressed layoff concerns. He clarified that TCS is not targeting job cuts but will evaluate all employees. The company has seen a 1% workforce reduction, with further evaluations planned for those who cannot be redeployed. Kunnumal also mentioned TCS's localized US workforce and adaptability to H-1B visa rule changes.

title: Trade Rumor: Red Sox tipped to land $80M Phillies star to boost offense
content: Boston Red Sox are eyeing a reunion with powerful free agent Kyle Schwarber, a former fan favorite. A potential sign-and-trade could send outfielder Jarren Duran and a pitching prospect to Philadelphia. This move would inject much-needed power into Boston's lineup and offer the Phillies financial flexibility and defensive upgrades, creating a win-win scenario for both clubs.

title: Ayesha Curry sparks outrage for flaunting luxury after controversial remarks
content: Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha Curry, is facing backlash from fans after a recent Instagram post featuring her playing golf with friends. Critics have accused her of not appreciating her husband and her life, stemming from previous comments on a podcast where she revealed she hadn't initially wanted marriage or children.

title: Kelly Stafford’s note to Hailee Steinfeld wins hearts across NFL
content: NFL star Josh Allen praised his wife Hailee Steinfeld. Matthew Stafford's wife Kelly Stafford shared Allen's interview, wishing every player had such support. Her message went viral, celebrating the quiet strength of spouses. This highlights the vital role partners play in the lives of football stars, both on and off the field.

title: Mavericks vs Lakers preseason injury report: Who’s playing and who’s out
content: Dallas Mavericks and Los Angeles Lakers clashed in a Las Vegas preseason game, with Dallas prioritizing chemistry and integrating Anthony Davis. The Lakers, however, focused on rest and player development due to injuries and load management. This strategic divergence offered a preview of each team's approach to the upcoming NBA season.

title: Bihar polls: Congress fields over 15 candidates; no Mahagathbandhan seat-sharing deal yet
content: With nominations for the Bihar Assembly elections nearing, the Congress released its first list of over 10 candidates amidst unresolved seat-sharing talks with Mahagathbandhan partners. The party faces internal discontent over alleged irregularities in ticket distribution. Meanwhile, the NDA alliance has also navigated friction over seat allocations.

title: Aryna Sabalenka’s emotional gesture for Rafael Nadal’s museum wins hearts
content: Aryna Sabalenka celebrated her 2025 US Open victory by gifting her championship outfit to Rafael Nadal's museum in Mallorca. The signed Nike attire, worn during her second consecutive US Open win, is now a prized exhibit. Sabalenka's gesture highlights her deep admiration for Nadal's work ethic and enduring legacy in tennis.

title: Malcolm Brogdon retirement: NBA star’s heartfelt message marks end of journey
content: Veteran point guard Malcolm Brogdon has abruptly retired from the NBA after nine seasons, informing the New York Knicks of his decision. Brogdon, a former Rookie of the Year and Sixth Man of the Year, cited a desire to end his career on his own terms. His unexpected departure leaves the Knicks with a void at the point guard position.

title: Chaos! Fan climbs enclosure, breaks into Pakistan dressing room to meet Babar Azam - WATCH
content: A young fan breached security at Gaddafi Stadium during a cricket match. The fan sought to meet star batsman Babar Azam. This occurred on Azam's birthday. Security personnel intervened and removed the fan. The Pakistan Cricket Board has not yet commented on the incident. Babar Azam remains a popular figure among fans.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury update: Cowboys star on track for Week 7 vs Commanders
content: Dallas Cowboys' star receiver CeeDee Lamb is nearing a return from a high-ankle sprain, potentially for Week 7 against the Commanders.  Lamb has shown significant progress, participating in team walkthroughs and expected to practice. His comeback would significantly bolster the Cowboys' offense, especially in the passing game and red zone, offering a crucial boost for their playoff hopes.

title: Taylor Swift’s strict friendship rule leaves Blake Lively heartbroken
content: A rift has reportedly formed between Taylor Swift and Blake Lively following a legal dispute involving Justin Baldoni. Sources suggest Swift has closed the door on their friendship, leaving Lively devastated. While Swift focuses on her new album and relationship with Travis Kelce, Lively grapples with the fallout, with neither star publicly addressing the situation.

title: What happens when you drink clove water after meal for 30 days
content: Embrace a month of clove water after meals for a natural health boost. This ancient remedy significantly enhances digestion, reduces bloating, and strengthens your immune system. It also aids in regulating blood sugar levels and promotes overall well-being. Discover the potent benefits of this simple, traditional drink for a healthier you.

title: Amla benefits: Lowers bad cholesterol and supports better heart health
content: Ancient Indian gooseberry, or Amla, is scientifically proven to boost heart health by significantly improving cholesterol levels. Rich in antioxidants, it prevents LDL oxidation and reduces inflammation, crucial for cardiovascular well-being. Consuming fresh amla or unsweetened juice offers maximum benefits, while sugary preparations should be avoided. Consult a doctor before use.

title: Drama! Ramiz Raja and Aamer Sohail mock India; Pakistan & South Africa share handshakes
content: Pakistani teams received handshakes from opponents in hockey and cricket, a welcome sight amidst lingering tensions. Despite a dominant 93-run Test victory over South Africa, commentators used the moment to criticize India's past refusal to reciprocate sportsmanship, highlighting the ongoing impact of the Asia Cup controversy.

title: A failed state? Pak losing war within; how 'Quad of Terror' is taking control
content: Pakistan faces its deadliest year in a decade. Violence surges, with security personnel deaths on track to exceed 2024. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Balochistan are major battlegrounds. The nation confronts a 'Quad of Terror' including TTP, Baloch insurgents, IS-K, and elements within the Afghan Taliban. Border clashes with Afghanistan intensify.

title: Bihar polls: BJP-JD(U) & RJD show odd unity - the reason, Prashant Kishor
content: Bihar's political rivals, BJP-JD(U) and RJD, united in mocking Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor for opting out of the upcoming assembly elections. Leaders from all three parties dismissed his aspirations, calling his decision a premature admission of defeat and an embarrassment to his workers, suggesting his political ambitions have been thwarted.

title: Kim Zolciak’s new romance after Kroy Biermann divorce sparks legal drama
content: Reality star Kim Zolciak is embroiled in drama as she faces a subpoena in her new boyfriend Kyle Mowitz's $100 million divorce. Kyle's estranged wife, Jillian Green, is demanding communications and financial proof between Kim and Kyle. Kim, who recently started dating Kyle after her own split, was reportedly served papers publicly.

title: Is Luka Doncic playing tonight vs Mavericks? Latest update on Lakers star’s injury
content: Luka Doncic is expected to play tonight against the Dallas Mavericks after a stellar preseason debut, though the Lakers may limit his minutes.  LeBron James is still recovering from a sciatica injury, and Adou Thiero is out with knee swelling. Doncic, however, is healthy and ready to boost the Lakers' prospects for the upcoming season.

title: Tellis tale isn't a tell-all: Scholar charged for keeping top secret files - not spying
content: Renowned scholar Ashley Tellis faces charges for unlawfully retaining national defense information and undocumented meetings with Chinese officials. The FBI's investigation, triggered by surveillance, uncovered classified documents at his home. While the think-tank community expresses shock, many argue that meeting foreign officials is part of his role, though document handling is questioned.

title: 'Nothing is well in NDA': BJP bets big on Chirag, again; Bihar allies in a tizzy
content: NDA allies Upendra Kushwaha and Jitan Ram Manjhi are expressing discontent over seat allocations in Bihar, particularly Chirag Paswan's LJP(Ram Vilas) receiving 29 seats. Political analysts suggest this move by the BJP might be a strategy to sideline Nitish Kumar post-election.

title: Is Virat Kohli leaving RCB and retiring from IPL? 'He will play his last match ... '
content: Virat Kohli's future with Royal Challengers Bengaluru is secure. He has committed to playing for the franchise. Reports of him leaving are incorrect. Kohli has not signed a new commercial deal as he awaits potential changes in franchise ownership. He continues to be a key player for RCB and has promised to play his first and last match for Bengaluru.

title: From nine to all: Trump’s funding 'Compact' expands; campuses wary
content: The Trump administration has expanded the Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education to all U.S. colleges, linking federal funding to bans on DEI initiatives and strict caps on international students. MIT rejected the proposal, citing academic principles, while other institutions remain cautious. Experts warn the compact could deepen funding divides and challenge campus autonomy nationwide.

title: ‘Tum kisi aur ke liye aaye ho’: Jasprit Bumrah loses cool at media - watch
content: Indian pace bowler Jasprit Bumrah expressed his annoyance with the media outside Mumbai airport, stating he hadn't invited them. He was later rested for the upcoming ODI series against Australia but is part of the T20I squad.

title: Bihar polls: 30 newbies, 0 Muslims - what JD(U)'s 1st list reveals about Nitish's game plan
content: Nitish Kumar's JD(U) has unveiled its first list of 57 candidates for the Bihar assembly elections, fielding 30 new faces alongside 27 incumbents. The party aims to retain power, balancing caste equations with a focus on OBC, SC, and EBC nominees. Notably, no Muslim candidates were included in this initial selection.

title: Bears in the house: Polar giants chilling in abandoned Arctic station - see images
content: Remarkable drone footage reveals polar bears seeking refuge in an abandoned Russian research station on Kolyuchin Island. Photographer Vadim Makhorov captured these images, showcasing the bears' adaptability as their natural sea ice hunting grounds shrink. This unusual sight highlights the impact of climate change on Arctic wildlife and their interaction with forgotten human structures.

title: 'Forgive me': Bengal rape victim's father calls Mamata 'mother-like'; seeks justice
content: The father of Durgapur gang rape victim has sought forgiveness from Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee after previously criticizing her remarks on women's safety. He described Banerjee as a "mother-like figure" and pleaded for her help in securing justice for his daughter, urging her to forgive any harsh words spoken earlier.

title: Kings' Murray secures 5-year, $140M extension
content: Kings forward Keegan Murray has agreed to a five-year, $140 million rookie contract extension with the franchise, his representatives told ESPN.

title: Tua apologizes for comments: 'Made a mistake'
content: Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa apologized Wednesday for criticizing teammates for being late to players-only meetings.

title: Lions safety Branch's 1-game suspension upheld
content: Brian Branch will miss the Lions' game Monday night against the Buccaneers and will be eligible to return to the active roster the following day.

title: Source: 'Outrage' over surface at Steelers field
content: Players from the Steelers and Browns expressed "outrage" and concerns to the NFLPA about the "embarrassing" playing surface last weekend at Acrisure Stadium, a union source told ESPN.

title: Knicks' Brogdon retiring after nine NBA seasons
content: Knicks guard Malcolm Brogdon, a former NBA Rookie of the Year and Sixth Man of the Year, has decided to retire after nine NBA seasons, he told ESPN.

title: Sources: Orioles interested in Pujols for manager
content: The Orioles, seeking a new manager to guide their young, emerging core, have expressed interest in Albert Pujols, sources told ESPN.

title: Bears' Williams: 'Could care less' about criticism
content: Bears quarterback Caleb Williams said he "could care less" about commentary about his play following Chicago's victory on "Monday Night Football."

title: Pickens noncommittal on future with Cowboys
content: George Pickens, who is set to become an unrestricted free agent after the season, praised the Cowboys but noted he also wants to "showcase my talents."

content: After a stunning free fall, Penn State's coach is out of a job but still has a spot on our list of outcasts.

content: Flagg's NBA coming out party was last summer as he nearly upset Team USA ahead of the Paris Olympics.

content: Scandals and abuse allegations forced the Portland Thorns to find new owners, but decoupling from the Timbers organization has been a work in progress.

content: There are 88 national teams that could win the FIFA World Cup next summer. With only three international breaks left before the tournament, we rank every team.

title: Chelsea's Champions League response vs. Paris FC is just what Bompastor & Co. needed
content: With Chelsea's 4-0 win over Paris FC in the Champions League, Sonia Bompastor's team can feel a bit of ease going into the international break.

title: Why Spain's player production line is the envy of the world
content: What's remarkable about Luis De La Fuente's Spain is that despite getting stripped of their elite talents, they keep winning and thrilling anyway.

title: How 'Abbott Elementary' turned an all-time Kyle Schwarber performance into an episode
content: Abbott Elementary" continues to embrace Philadelphia sports culture, and its latest outing has the cast cheering on the Phillies.

title: Warriors in the Finals? Lakers under .500?! We simulated the entire 2025-26 NBA season
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton used simulation No. 620 to run through the NBA season from Opening Night to the Finals.

title: Talent, emotional intelligence and a lifetime of sacrifice have made Oscar Piastri a F1 title favorite
content: There's no doubting Oscar Piastri's talent, but what's set him apart in his F1 title quest is his ability to control his emotions.

content: Are you ready for your salary cap draft? Jim McCormick lays out helpful strategies and tactics you can use to ace draft day.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Juventus eye Milinkovic-Savic
content: Chelsea and Juventus are both competing to sign Sergej Milinkovic-Savic. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: India pitches for supply of Akash missile system to Brazil as Rajnath Singh holds talks with Brazilian Vice-President
content: The two leaders “identified priority areas” for joint work, including exploring opportunities for co-development and co-production of defence equipment

title: Bengal Governor files report on Durgapur gang rape to President, Home Ministry: Official
content: In the report, Mr. Bose has given a detailed account of his findings in the case and also about his interactions with the survivor and her parents who hail from Odisha

title: PM Modi brought revolution in urban development inspired by Sardar Patel’s ideals: Gujarat CM
content: Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel said that Ahmedabad “truly exemplifies PM Modi’s mantra of Vikas bhi Virasat bhi

title: India’s biotech surge builds momentum but faces scale bottlenecks
content: Leadership in biotechnology will require India to streamline its ecosystem and channel resources into high-impact areas. The government, industry leaders, and academia need to consolidate funding, build integrated infrastructure, and reconcile regulatory standards with international best practices

title: Hitachi Energy’s next phase in Chennai at ₹2,000 crore to provide 3,000 jobs
content: Industries Minister T.R.B. Rajaa said that the Chief Minister on Wednesday met with Hitachi Energy’s leadership to finalise their next phase of expansion in the State

title: Anbumani accuses State govt. of scuttling his padayatra
content: Dr. Anbumani claimed the government was continuously lying about the job creation and influx of investments coming into Tamil Nadu.

title: BJD slams Odisha CM for making his conversation with West Bengal rape survivor public
content: Despite recurrence of rape and gangrape incidents in Odisha over the last 15 months, the CM remained silent, charged Sulata Deo, BJD Rajya Sabha MP

title: Young and jobless: key demographic weighs claims and promises of parties
content: NDA government says it has been distributing lakhs of appointment letters for jobs in different sectors, with the Chief Minister promising at several events that ‘one crore more jobs will be given in the future’; Tejashwi says lakhs of jobs were provided during the 17 months of grand alliance rule

title: CPI(M) seeks judicial probe into Dalit IPS officer’s death
content: The party also called for the immediate suspension of all officials named by the late officer to prevent any interference in the investigation

title: Chaos at Patna airport as Bihar Congress leaders are heckled by party cadre
content: Congress workers from the Bikram assembly constituency confronted the leaders when they arrived at the airport alleging corruption in ticket distribution.

title: FIR registered over ASI Sandeep Lather’s death; CM Nayab Saini, Opposition leader Hooda express condolences
content: His family gives consent to post-mortem; the deceased ASI had made allegations of corruption against the late IPS officer Puran and his family in a four-page note and video

title: Police deter escalation between groups over Ambedkar statue installation in Gwalior
content: More than 4,200 personnel are currently deployed in the city, including over 700 called in from neighbouring districts, along with arrangements for tear gas and other measures to prevent any escalation.

title: Cough syrup deaths: another child from Madhya Pradesh dies during treatment in Nagpur
content: Chhindwara Additional Collector Dhirendra Singh said the child had been admitted in Nagpur since September 14 but her condition did not improve

title: Balancing lives and conservation
content: Kerala amends wildlife laws to tackle rising human-wildlife conflicts while raising concerns over ecological impact

title: Bihar polls: BJP announces third list of 18 candidates
content: In the third list, BJP has fielded Satish Kumar Yadav from Raghopur Assembly seat to take on former Deputy Chief Minister and RJD Leader Tejashwi Yadav.

title: LDF takes out rally, holds public meeting in Perambra
content: Senior CPI(M) leader accuses Cong. activists of assaulting Perambra panchayat president without any provocation

title: Karnataka Social and Educational Survey: Enumerators struggle amid long hours of work and hostile responses
content: As on Wednesday, out of a total of about 46 lakh households to be surveyed under Greater Bengaluru Authority limits, a little over 15 lakh were covered

title: Karnataka to ready 300-acre data centre park at Tavarekere in 18 months
content: According to industry experts, Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu are quite ahead of Karnataka in terms of data centre infrastructure

title: BJP firefights as allies protest seat allocation to LJP(RV)
content: Two NDA allies, Upendra Kushwaha’s Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) and Jitan Ram Manjhi’s Hindustan Awam Morcha, have publicly expressed their displeasure. JD(U) has also conveyed their objections while refraining from making any public remarks.

title: Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Saini assures justice and support to family of deceased ASI
content: His family says it would allow the post-mortem only after a case is registered, demands probe into four-page note and video left by him

title: Supreme Court issues notice on plea seeking access to lawyer during inquiry
content: The petition says that though the right to consult a lawyer during an inquiry is statutorily recognised, it is not uniformly enforced by investigating agencies

title: Battleground Bhabanipur: Mamata says outsiders filling up her constituency, Suvendu vows to defeat her
content: West Bengal CM says slums are being replaced by highrises full of outsiders, driving her voters away from Bhabanipur; Leader of Opposition says BJP leads in five out of eight wards in the constituency

title: Vellore Corporation issues NOC to relay VIT Road near Katpadi station
content: Corporation officials said that the stretch, which is 2.6 km long and 14 metres wide, was taken up to lay underground pipelines and construction of manholes for drainage work more than six months ago.

title: NSA Ajit Doval in Bishkek for meeting security partners of Central Asia
content: The overall security situation, especially the Afghanistan-Pakistan border conflict, is expected to be part of the discussion

title: Karnataka to upgrade 800 govt. schools to KPS at ₹3,000 crore
content: KPS are model government-run schools that provide education from pre-primary to II PU under one roof, with both English and Kannada medium options

title: Book on Mannarsala Sree Nagaraja Temple released
content: The 96-page book, featuring a sweeping range of photographs, explores the unique socio-religious and ecological landscape of one of the country’s most important centres of Naga worship

title: Night light data from 2013 and 2023 reveals limited urban growth in Bihar
content: Nighttime illumination is used as a proxy to gauge electricity usage and identify levels of urbanisation; very high illumination rose from 0% in 2013 to 1.6% in 2023, and was seen only in Patna

title: Sundarbans aquaculture model wins FAO global recognition
content: Nature Environment and Wildlife Society’s mangrove-linked aquaculture project lauded as a model for sustainable livelihoods

title: BJP lines up nominees for bypolls in Jharkhand, Odisha, Telangana, J&K
content: Bypolls are scheduled to be held on November 11, along with the second phase of the Bihar Assembly election

title: Andhra Pradesh needs SCS, not GST festivals, says APCC chief Y.S. Sharmila
content: There is no truth in the government’s claims that GST cuts increased people’s purchasing power, she asserts

title: Andhra Pradesh electricity employees’ talks with power utilities on October 17
content: The AP State Power Employees’ Joint Action Committee to hold a fresh round of negotiations with Chief Secretary Vijayanand on a host of demands

title: Veteran singer Rao Balasaraswati passes away
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan remembered her as a first-generation singer and actress who earned a special place in classical and light music

title: Over 11,000 applications received for next Haj season
content: Telangana was allotted a quota of 4,292 seats and 3,453 were selected by means of drawing lots; 4,617 applicants on the waiting list

title: Record number of women officers, major career shifts shape Telangana’s latest IPS cohort
content: With 35.63% women officers, the highest in past five years, this year’s cohort graduating from Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel National Police Academy marks a big stride towards inclusivity in police leadership

title: ‘Will appeal to government to give 200 more units of free power for hair cutting salons in A.P.’
content: Present government has increased the wages of barbers working in temples from ₹20,000 to ₹25,000, says State Nayee Brahmin Sadhikara Samithi president

title: CBI probe essential on Sabarimala gold ‘theft’, says Kodikunnil Suresh
content: Congress leader lashes out at CPI(M) and LDF government during Vishwasa Samrakshana Yatra in Thrissur district

title: Bihar polls: JDU releases 1st list; includes 5 seats Chirag wanted
content: CM Nitish Kumar-headed JDU released its first list of 57 candidates for the bihar assembly elections . the move is seen as JDU’s unwillingness to fully implement NDA’s seat-sharing arrangement . 57, 18 sitting MLAs retained, four denied tickets, and at least six ministers of the current govt have been re-nominated .

title: SC says ‘yes’ to green crackers: Allowed for two days on Diwali, online sale banned
content: a bench of CJI B R Gavai and justice K Vinod Chandran ordered district administrations and police to 'ensure that use of firecrackers shall be confined between 6-7am and 8-10pm on the two days i.e. the one before and on Diwali day' but SC banned sale of crackers through e-commerce websites and transportation of any kind of cracker from outside into the National Capital Region (NCR)

title: Leh court grants bail to Congress councillor, six others in September 24 violence case
content: BJP has accused councillor Stanzin Tsepag of leading violent protests that resulted in police firing . BJP hinged its allegation on a viral photo showing a masked man holding a stick . the party denies the claim, calling it "propaganda to malign the party"

title: Rail push: 7,000 km high-speed passenger corridors across India; Vande Bharat 4.0 soon
content: the dedicated passenger corridors will be designed for a speed of 350 kmph . the minister warned suppliers and manufacturers against compromising on quality of products . he said there are three major focus areas for railways: provide enough service for passengers and their comfort .

title: YouTube Down For Thousands Of Users In US: Report
content: Alphabet-owned YouTube was down for over 320,000 users in the United States on Wednesday evening, according to Downdetector.

title: "Great Man": Trump Praises PM Modi's Meeting With US Envoy Sergio Gor
content: Lauding Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a "great man," US President Donald Trump praised the outcome of the recent meeting between US Ambassador-designate Sergio Gor and the Indian leader.

title: Venezuela President Nicolas Maduro Decries "Coups Orchestrated By CIA"
content: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro on Wednesday decried what he called "coups d'etat orchestrated by the CIA" shortly after US counterpart Donald Trump said he was considering strikes against Venezuelan cartels on land.

title: US Tariffs Not A Matter Of Huge Concern For India's Growth: RBI Governor
content: India has recorded phenomenal growth with over 8 per cent projections in the past year amid unprecedented global uncertainties, RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said at the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) annual meeting on Wednesday.

title: UK PM Keir Starmer Publishes Evidence In Collapsed China Spy Case
content: The UK government published evidence Wednesday it had submitted in now-collapsed legal proceedings against two men accused of spying for China, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer seeks to contain controversy over the failed case.

title: Israel Threatens To Resume Fighting If Hamas Does Not Respect Gaza Deal
content: Israel's defence minister on Wednesday threatened to resume fighting if Hamas does not honour the terms of a US-backed ceasefire that halted the war in Gaza.

title: Trump Claims PM Modi Has Assured Him "India Will Not Buy Oil From Russia"
content: US President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Prime Minister Narendra Modi told him that India will stop buying oil from Russia, a move Trump described as a "big step" in efforts to isolate Moscow economically.

title: Trump Confirms He Authorised Covert CIA Operations In Venezuela
content: US President Donald Trump confirmed reports on Wednesday that he authorised the CIA to conduct covert operations in Venezuela, marking a sharp escalation in U.S. efforts to pressure President Nicolas Maduro's government.

title: Planning Underway For International Force In Gaza, Says US Adviser
content: The United States is looking to establish a basic stabilization of Gaza and planning is underway for an international force to go into the Palestinian enclave, said a senior U.S. adviser, speaking on condition of anonymity, on Wednesday.

title: US Court Temporarily Halts Shutdown Layoffs Of Federal Workers
content: A federal judge ordered a temporary halt on Wednesday to the layoffs by the Trump administration of thousands of federal workers during the government shutdown, US media reported.

title: Protestors, Cops Clash As 5 Accused In Zubeen Garg Case Moved To Another Jail
content: A massive protest broke out in Assam's Baksa district after five people, who were arrested in connection with the death of singer Zubeen Garg in Singapore last month, were shifted to a newly constructed prison on Wednesday.

title: Plane Carrying US Defence Secretary Makes Emergency Landing In UK
content: Hegseth was returning to the United States from a NATO defense ministers meeting in Brussels when his plane made the unscheduled landing at an unnamed airport in Britain, a spokesperson said.

title: Career CIA Officer To NDTV On Why He's Convinced Indian-Origin Expert Ashley Tellis Is Chinese Spy
content: Glen Carle, a career Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) officer who has served in the US National Intelligence Council, in an interview to NDTV explained why he is convinced that Indian-American strategic affairs expert Ashley J Tellis was spying.

title: 'China Vs World': US Seeks Group Response To Beijing's Rare Earth Move
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Wednesday reiterated Washington's desire to build a "fulsome group response" to Chinese export controls on rare earths, including proposed talks with Indian officials.

title: BJP Announces All 101 Names For Bihar, Releases 3rd List Of 18 Candidates
content: Late on Wednesday night, the BJP announced its third list of 18 candidates, taking the total count of declared candidates to 101, also the number of seats allotted to the party in the final seat-sharing distribution within the NDA for Bihar polls.

title: 3 Baloch Civilians Forcibly Disappeared By Pakistani Forces
content: Several human rights organisations on Wednesday raised grave concerns after three Baloch civilians were forcibly disappeared by Pakistani forces in Balochistan.

title: Explained: Britain's Chinese Spying Case And Its Collapse
content: The British government has come under sustained criticism after a prosecution against two men accused of spying for China collapsed last month, with critics saying it was because of fears of upsetting Beijing.

title: 25 Transgender Persons Consume 'Phenyl' In Madhya Pradesh, Hospitalised
content: Around 25 people from the transgender community in Indore claimed to have consumed phenyl together on Wednesday night after which they were admitted to a government hospital, an official said.

title: Madurai Mayor Resigns Amid Alleged Rs 200-Crore Property Tax Scam
content: Madurai Mayor and DMK leader Indrani Ponvasanth has resigned from her post amid allegations of a multi-crore property tax scam.

title: US Think Tank Sends Indian-Origin Defence Expert Ashley Tellis On Leave
content: Indian-origin foreign policy scholar and defence strategist Ashley J Tellis, considered one of Washington's leading authorities on South Asian security and US-India relations, has been sent on leave by the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace.

title: Indore tragedy: 25 transgenders consume phenyl; admitted to hospital
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Jaisalmer bus fire: Death toll reaches 21; 2 officials suspended
content: nine-year-old Yunus succumbed to his injuries during treatment . four other patients remain on ventilators in a critical condition at the hospital . govt suspended acting district transport officer and assistant administrative officer .

title: Record ops: ‘Most affected’ left-wing-hit districts down to 3 from 7
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. Read More

title: What to know ahead of the U.S. Grand Prix at Austin
content: ESPN's Laurence Edmondson lays out the possibility of Max Verstappen making a late run for the drivers' championship . the weekend is set to be hot and sunny with temperatures above 30°C (86°F) Saturday is expected to peak at 34°C, giving the drivers another heat test after Singapore .

title: From train rides to Reggie Bush: The best games in the USC-Notre Dame rivalry
content: Notre Dame-USC rivalry nationalized football in the mid-1920s . it was a massive game right from its origin . the Trojans and Fighting Irish will meet for the 96th time on saturday .

title: 'He is a great man': Trump says PM Modi assured him India won't buy Russian oil; hits out at Putin
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. title: Follow live: Vladdy Jr. blasts solo homer to grow Blue Jays' lead
content: the first matchup at T-Mobile Park isn't an elimination game, but the stakes couldn't be much higher . only one team in MLB history has ever come back from trailing a postseason series 3-0 . it's a chance to get one victory away from the first world Series appearance in franchise history .

title: AP preseason Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the 2025-26 preseason women's college basketball AP Top 25 poll results are out . the reigning champion UConn Huskies top the list, with the rest of last season's final four -- the UCLA Bruins and Texas Longhorns round out the top four .

title: Opening night or late-season debuts? Key NBA superstar injury returns to watch for
content: a week away from opening tipoff for the 2025-26 season . a few familiar faces and some new ones ready to take the court starting Oct. 21 . leBron James is expected to sit out three to four weeks .

title: Bracketology: Finally, some qualitative data to add to the projections
content: the weekly in-season Bracketology will begin a week into the 2025-26 campaign, on Nov. 11 . the Cougars recently received a procedural advantage that could pay very substantial dividends in March .
